summary: Dow Jones Industrial Average edged up 0.3% to extend 5-day win streak . Moody's downgrade of US credit rating from AAA to AA1 late Friday . Longer-dated Treasury yields eased from their session highs as stocks eke out gains .  The 30-year equivalent (^TYX) broke above 5% — a level not seen since late 2023 . Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent warned countries that their imports will return to facing "Liberation Day" hikes if they don't negotiate deals "in good faith" during the 90-day pause .  The Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) edged up roughly 0.3% to extend its five-day win streak . Target (TGT) and Home Depot (HD) are slated to report later in the week . Bitcoin (BTC-USD) hovered near its highest level since January, surpassing $105,000 per token .  Stocks initially fell in the immediate reaction to Moody's US credit downgrades . But the releases didn't have lasting impacts on the S&P 500's performance . The rise from session lows reflected the reaction of many Wall Street strategists .  Shares of Apple (AAPL) and Alibaba (BABA) were down on Monday following a New York Timesreportstating that the Trump administration is concerned about a deal between the two companies that would make the Chinese company's artificial intelligence available on iPhones in China . On Monday, both Apple and Baba stock dropped roughly 2% amid an overall overall drop .  Bitcoin exchange service is first and only cryptocurrency platform to see stock join S&P 500 index . Shares are up more than 25% since news broke a week ago that the crypto exchange provider would be added to the broad benchmark index . Stocks fell on Monday, with Tech and Consumer Discretionary leading to the downside .  Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) fell about0.6%, S&P 500 (^GSPC) dropped more than 1% . Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) sank 1.5% . Moody's cut US government’s long-term credit rating from Aaa to Aa1 late Friday .  Palantir shares slid 4% an hour before the opening bell . Tesla stock fell 3.6% after coming off another strong week of double-digit gains . Novavax (NVAX) stock shot up more than 16% premarket on Monday after getting FDA approval for its COVID-19 vaccine .  The yield on 30-year Treasurys rose to the key 5% level early on Monday after Moody's became the last of the major ratings agencies to downgrade US credit . Shares in Nvidia dropped around 3% in the wake of the news from the Computex Taipei tech expo in Taiwan .  S&P 500 futures slid 1.2% on Monday following the debt downgrade, which Moody’s said was in response to a ballooning budget deficit that showed little sign of narrowing . The move has reignited worries about whether US assets are still popular at a time of lingering global trade uncertainty .  Shares of Walmart slipped in premarket trading after President Trump took aim at retailer over tariff price hikes . Treasury Secretary, Scott Bessent, meanwhile played down concerns about a tariff boost to inflation .  China’s National Bureau of Statistics reported April industrial output rose 6.1% year-over-year, slowing from 7.7% in March but beating forecasts . Retail sales climbed 5.1%, below the expected 5.5% and down from 5.9% . Markets across the region responded negatively as Hong Kong's Hang Seng (^HSI) dropped 0.5%, while China's CSI 300 (000821.SS) lost 0 .5% .  F.C. rating pushed investors toward haven assets . Bloomberg reports: Read more here. The ratings crisis has pushed investors to invest in safe assets .
